intro: Statice arborea, commonly known as the tree statice, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, which includes other flowering plants known for their showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for coastal gardens. Statice arborea is often used in floral arrangements due to its long-lasting blooms and attractive appearance.
